title: Contributing
text: use Convertional commits commit messages. fixing bugs adding features need state one commit message: bug: fixing memory > increment bug number (third) version number 1.2.3 1.2.4 feat: adding new functionality > increment minor number (second) version number 1.2.3 1.3.3 breaking: comply new upstream version X > increment major number (first) version number 1.2.3 1.3.3

title: MolgenisArmadillo
text: order access files data manager, need log . login method needs URLs Armadillo server MinIO fileserver. open browser window can identify ID provider. create session store credentials environment.

title: MolgenisArmadillo
text: need share data via Armadillo can nested structure save data. distinguish: projects folders tables

title: MolgenisArmadillo
text: Projects sort root-folders can give persons permissions . can imagine use seperate project study need support. way make sure people can see eachothers variables.

title: MolgenisArmadillo
text: Folder objects can used version different tables want share Armadillo. mandatory free use folder level see fit. examples go versioning part bit deeper.

title: MolgenisArmadillo
text: Tables actual tables R contain data want share. can data certain subject, mostly used consortia specific study want expose.

title: MolgenisArmadillo
text: Let’s asume consortia core-variables outcome-variables. want share version whole dataset researchers applied access data. First create project. case “cohort1”. Secondly load table(s) want upload Armadillo R-environment. test data arrow format, upload take object table like structure upload Armadillo. can SPSS, STATA, SAS R-based data well. third step determining second level, contains case datamodel-version type variables data-version. y_y-#variable-type#-x_x y_y = datamodel version x_x = data version tables containing naming scheme need drop data frames memory can reassign . See example .
code: armadillo.create_project("cohort1") #> Created project 'cohort1' library(arrow) #>  #> Attaching package: 'arrow' #> The following object is masked from 'package:utils': #>  #>     timestamp  # load the core data nonrep <- arrow::read_parquet("data/core/nonrep.parquet") yearlyrep <- arrow::read_parquet("data/core/yearlyrep.parquet") monthlyrep <- arrow::read_parquet("data/core/monthlyrep.parquet") trimesterrep <- arrow::read_parquet("data/core/trimesterrep.parquet") # upload the core variables armadillo.upload_table("cohort1", "2_1-core-1_0", nonrep) #> Compressing... #> Uploaded 2_1-core-1_0/nonrep armadillo.upload_table("cohort1", "2_1-core-1_0", yearlyrep) #> Compressing... #> Uploaded 2_1-core-1_0/yearlyrep armadillo.upload_table("cohort1", "2_1-core-1_0", monthlyrep) #> Compressing... #> Uploaded 2_1-core-1_0/monthlyrep armadillo.upload_table("cohort1", "2_1-core-1_0", trimesterrep) #> Compressing... #> Uploaded 2_1-core-1_0/trimesterrep # drop the old assignments rm(nonrep, yearlyrep, monthlyrep, trimesterrep)  # load the outcome data yearlyrep <- arrow::read_parquet("data/outcome/yearlyrep.parquet") nonrep <- arrow::read_parquet("data/outcome/nonrep.parquet")  # upload the outcome variables armadillo.upload_table("cohort1", "1_1-outcome-1_0", nonrep) #> Compressing... #> Uploaded 1_1-outcome-1_0/nonrep armadillo.upload_table("cohort1", "1_1-outcome-1_0", yearlyrep) #> Compressing... #> Uploaded 1_1-outcome-1_0/yearlyrep

title: MolgenisArmadillo
text: helper functions help determine storage server. can list projects tables ’s storage. can download data R-environment well. Now can also take look files user interface MinIO fileserver open MinIO server URL browser window.
code: # listing tables per project armadillo.list_projects() #>  [1] "longitools"   "genr"         "gecko"        "test"         "omics"        #>  [6] "trajectories" "inma"         "subset13"     "cohort1"      "study1" # listing tables per project armadillo.list_tables("cohort1") #> [1] "cohort1/2_1-core-1_0/trimesterrep" "cohort1/2_1-core-1_0/nonrep"       #> [3] "cohort1/2_1-core-1_0/yearlyrep"    "cohort1/2_1-core-1_0/monthlyrep"   #> [5] "cohort1/1_1-outcome-1_0/nonrep"    "cohort1/1_1-outcome-1_0/yearlyrep" # download table to local R environment trimesterrep <- armadillo.load_table("cohort1", "2_1-core-1_0", "trimesterrep")  # check the column names from the local environment colnames(trimesterrep) #> [1] "row_id"        "child_id"      "age_trimester" "smk_t"         #> [5] "alc_t"

title: MolgenisArmadillo
text: delete data need throw away contents first. Now can delete project.
code: # throw away the core tables armadillo.delete_table("cohort1", "2_1-core-1_0", "nonrep") #> Deleted '2_1-core-1_0/nonrep' armadillo.delete_table("cohort1", "2_1-core-1_0", "yearlyrep") #> Deleted '2_1-core-1_0/yearlyrep' armadillo.delete_table("cohort1", "2_1-core-1_0", "trimesterrep") #> Deleted '2_1-core-1_0/trimesterrep' armadillo.delete_table("cohort1", "2_1-core-1_0", "monthlyrep") #> Deleted '2_1-core-1_0/monthlyrep'  # throw away the outcome tables armadillo.delete_table("cohort1", "1_1-outcome-1_0", "nonrep") #> Deleted '1_1-outcome-1_0/nonrep' armadillo.delete_table("cohort1", "1_1-outcome-1_0", "yearlyrep") #> Deleted '1_1-outcome-1_0/yearlyrep' armadillo.delete_project("cohort1") #> Deleted project 'cohort1'

title: Create resources
text: datamanager need access Armadillo webinterface able access resource. using data following sources: https://github.com/isglobal-brge/brge_data_large/blob/master/data/gse66351_1.rda https://github.com/isglobal-brge/brge_data_large/blob/master/data/gse66351_2.rda Login institute account. Create project. example omics. Click edit project button right name project. Create new folder data. example ewas. Click “Select file upload” button drag file upload box click “Upload”. Upload omics data.

title: Create resources
text: second option upload data (resources) Central Analysis Server (CAS) within Rstudio datamanager first need login Armadillo (superuser)

title: Create resources
text: want install package Armadillo Rserver can execute following. selected profile always default none specified. profile doesn’t resourcer package installed, install :
code: library(resourcer) #> Loading required package: R6 #> Loading required package: httr #> Registering LocalFileResourceGetter... #> Registering HttpFileResourceGetter... #> Registering ScpFileResourceGetter... #> Registering GridFsFileResourceGetter... #> Registering OpalFileResourceGetter... #> Registering MariaDBResourceConnector... #> Registering PostgresResourceConnector... #> Registering SparkResourceConnector... #> Registering PrestoResourceConnector... #> Registering TidyFileResourceResolver... #> Registering ShellResourceResolver... #> Registering SshResourceResolver... #> Registering RDataFileResourceResolver... #> Registering RDSFileResourceResolver... #> Registering SQLResourceResolver... #> Registering NoSQLResourceResolver...

title: Create resources
text: order able assign data uploaded armadillo need create resources well. data files uploaded armadillo, can retrieved via following URL: yoururl + /storage/projects/{project name}/objects/{folder name}%2F{filename} example : https://armadillo-demo.molgenis.net/storage/projects/omics/objects/ewas%2Fgse66351_1.rda. URL https://armadillo-demo.molgenis.net/, project name omics, folder ewas name data file gse66351_1.rda. data now available researcher assign.
code: resGSE1 <- resourcer::newResource(   name = "GSE66351_1",   url = "https://armadillo-demo.molgenis.net/storage/projects/omics/objects/ewas%2Fgse66351_1.rda",   format = "ExpressionSet" ) resGSE2 <- resourcer::newResource(   name = "GSE66351_1",   url = "https://armadillo-demo.molgenis.net/storage/projects/omics/objects/ewas%2Fgse66351_1.rda",   format = "ExpressionSet" )  armadillo.upload_resource(project="omics", folder="ewas", resource = resGSE1, name = "GSE66351_1") #> Compressing... #> Uploaded ewas/GSE66351_1 armadillo.upload_resource(project="omics", folder="ewas", resource = resGSE2, name = "GSE66351_2") #> Compressing... #> Uploaded ewas/GSE66351_2

title: Creating data subsets
text: first need install load package able create subsets.

title: Creating data subsets
text: order access files, need log using URL Armadillo server. browser window opened can identify ID provider. session created credentials stored environment.
code: armadillo.login("https://armadillo-demo.molgenis.net/") #> [1] "We're opening a browser so you can log in with code 5FLGYF"

title: Creating data subsets
text: Let’s assume consortium data can shared entirety researchers. want share subset whole dataset certain researchers applied access data. two ways can .

what: Specify the required variables in a separate .csv file.
title: Creating data subsets
text: research project, first create .csv file containing 5 columns: ‘source_folder’ refers folder within master project; ‘source_table’ refers name table within folder, ‘target_folder’ refers name new folder within target project, ‘target_table’ refers name new table within ‘target_folder’ ‘variable’ refers one variables within source_table (‘source_project’ ‘target_project’ specified later). Note columns need named exactly . defined tables can construct ’subset_definition. creates tibble within R holding details .csv file. can create new subset using subset method within Armadillo. method generally best choice need create subsets multiple tables.
code: subset_definition <- armadillo.subset_definition(   reference_csv = "data/subset/vars.csv") subset_definition #> # A tibble: 3 × 5 #>   source_folder   source_table target_folder target_table target_vars       #>   <chr>           <chr>        <chr>         <chr>        <list>            #> 1 2_1-core-1_0    yearlyrep    core          year_rep     <tibble [14 × 1]> #> 2 1_1-outcome-1_0 yearlyrep    outcome       year_rep     <tibble [9 × 1]>  #> 3 2_1-core-1_0    nonrep       core          non_rep      <tibble [5 × 1]> armadillo.subset(   input_source = "subset_def",     source_project = "gecko",     target_project = "study1",     subset_def = subset_definition ) #> Created project 'study1' without users #> ✔ All views were successfully created! #> ✔ View 'core/year_rep' successfully created #> ✔ View 'outcome/year_rep' successfully created #> ✔ View 'core/non_rep' successfully created

title: Creating data subsets
text: alternative specify subset R, via arguments armadillo.subset function: method may easier need create one small subset.
code: armadillo.subset(   input_source = "arguments",     source_project = "gecko",     source_folder = "2_1-core-1_0",      source_table = "yearlyrep",     target_project = "study2",     target_folder = "core",     target_table = "year_rep",      target_vars = c("occup_f1_", "occupcode_f2_", "edu_f1_", "edu_f1_fath", "edu_f2_", "edu_f2_fath", "pets_", "cats_", "cats_quant_", "dogs_") ) #> Created project 'study2' without users #> ✔ All views were successfully created! #> ✔ View 'core/year_rep' successfully created

title: Creating data subsets

title: Install packages
text: first need login Armadillo (superuser)

title: Install packages
text: want install package Armadillo Rserver can execute following endpoint. selected profile always default none specified. order install packages specific profile can specify profile. can install multiple packages well specifying vector
code: armadillo.install_packages("data/packages/MolgenisArmadillo_1.1.0.9000.tar.gz") #> Error in httr::upload_file(path): file.exists(path) is not TRUE armadillo.install_packages("data/packages/MolgenisArmadillo_1.1.0.9000.tar.gz", profile = "exposome") armadillo.install_packages(c("data/packages/MolgenisArmadillo_1.1.0.9000.tar.gz", "data/packages/dsBase_6.1.0.9000.tar.gz"))

title: Install packages
text: able use new packages Armadillo need add whitelist. can executing following method. able whilist mulitple packages well using following line:
code: armadillo.whitelist_packages("MolgenisArmadillo") #> Error in armadillo.whitelist_packages("MolgenisArmadillo"): could not find function "armadillo.whitelist_packages" armadillo.whitelist_packages(c("MolgenisArmadillo", "dsBase")) #> Error in armadillo.whitelist_packages(c("MolgenisArmadillo", "dsBase")): could not find function "armadillo.whitelist_packages"

code: @Manual{,   title = {MolgenisArmadillo: Armadillo Client for the Armadillo Service},   author = {Mariska Slofstra and Sido Haakma and Tommy {de Boer} and Fleur Kelpin and Morris Swertz},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 2.3.4,  https://molgenis.github.io/molgenis-r-armadillo/},   url = {https://github.com/molgenis/molgenis-r-armadillo/}, }

what: Armadillo Client for the Armadillo Service
title: Armadillo Client for the Armadillo Service
text: Client share data MOLGENIS Armadillo DataSHIELD Service.

title: Armadillo Client for the Armadillo Service
text: library can used data managers share datasets MOLGENIS Armadillo server. Researchers can analyse datasets datasets shared servers using DataSHIELD. Researchers able access aggregate information see individual rows.

title: Armadillo Client for the Armadillo Service
text: datasets stored shared folders MinIO file store. MOLGENIS Armadillo server access file store can load data sets shielded RServe environment researchers can call DataSHIELD analysis methods data.

title: Armadillo Client for the Armadillo Service
text: Login service. Now can create project upload tables project share analysis. Listing tables. Removing data storage. First need remove content project can throw away project.
code: library('MolgenisArmadillo') armadillo.login("https://armadillo-url-example.org") library(datasets) armadillo.create_project("project") armadillo.upload_table("project", "folder", iris) armadillo.list_tables("project") armadillo.delete_table("project", "folder", "iris") armadillo.delete_project("project")

title: Armadillo Client for the Armadillo Service
text: depth documentation please check howto.

title: Armadillo Client for the Armadillo Service
text: newest version (2.x) MolgenisArmadillo compatible Armadillo version 3. still use Armadillo 2, use 1.1.13 version MolgenisArmadillo. can install specific version using following commands: already installed another version package, might want run first: windows additional R packages like rtools might required order install tar.gz package url.

title: Armadillo Client for the Armadillo Service
text: build documentation, devtools::document() run unit tests, devtools::test() writing code (tests), can use devtools::load_all() quickly “install” package. run single test file, open Rstudio devtools::test_active_file() run linter, devtools::lint(). Tip: run often :) create new README Rmd: run devtools::build_readme()

title: Describes data available to subset and makes subset — armadillo.subset
code: armadillo.subset(   input_source = NULL,   subset_def = NULL,   source_project = NULL,   source_folder = NULL,   source_table = NULL,   target_project = NULL,   target_folder = NULL,   target_table = NULL,   target_vars = NULL,   new_project = NULL,   dry_run = NULL )

title: Describes data available to subset and makes subset — armadillo.subset
text: input_source Character specifying information target view provided: choose 'subset_def' providing subset definition object, 'arguments' providing information directly. subset_def R object containing subset definition created armadillo.subset_definition(). Compulsory input_source = 'subset_def' source_project project subset data source_folder folder subset data. Compulsory input_source = 'arguments'. source_table table subset data. Compulsory input_source = 'arguments'. target_project project upload subset . created exist. target_folder folder upload subset . created exist. Compulsory input_source = 'arguments'. target_table table upload subset . Compulsory input_source = 'arguments'. target_vars variables `source_table` include view. Compulsory input_source = 'arguments'. new_project Deprecated: use target_project instead dry_run Defunct: previously enabgled dry-run check variables missing

title: Describes data available to subset and makes subset — armadillo.subset
text: missing variables provided subset definition

code: if (FALSE) { armadillo.subset(   source_project = "gecko",   target_project = "study1",   subset_def = local_subset ) }

title: Builds an R object containing info required to make subsets — armadillo.subset_definition
Builds an R object containing info required to make subsets — armadillo.subset_definition
text: reference_csv .csv file containing details variable subset. Must contain  5 columns: 'source_folder' specifying folder subset, 'souce_table' specifying table subset, 'target_folder' specifying folder create subset  'target_table' specifying name subset 'variable' specifying variable(s)  include subset. Note 'source_project' 'target_project' specified arguments `armadillo.subset`. vars Deprecated: use reference_csv instead
